item.title: The Trapped Knight
item.description: Introduction Link to heading Not too long ago while browsing, The Youtbe aglorithm blessed me with a Numberphile video called “The Trapped Knight”. Given simple rules for how a knight moves on a chess board, some intersting chaotic, patterns emerge. Rules Summary Link to heading Suppose an infinitly large chessboard. Give a square a numeric value of 1. This square will be the point of origin. From this origin, the rest of the real, positive integers will be put on the remaining squares in a spiral shape.

item.title: The Trapped Knight Variations
item.description: Introduction Link to heading The following variations will be explored from least to most interesting. The Stubborn Knight Link to heading Rule Modifications: The Knight will go the nth lowest unvisited square The Reincarnated Knight Link to heading Rule Modifications: The knight will visit the lowest, unvisited, undead square If the knight is trapped, the simulation is repeated but the trapped square will be marked as ‘dead’ The Clever knight Link to heading If the knight is trapped, the knight will move back to the previous square and go to the second lowest square The Anti-prime Knight Link to heading The knight cannot visit squres with a prime value The Forgetful Knight Link to heading The knight can only remember up to n previous squares

Automation Test Engineer - Boeing Link to heading Write Backend BDD tests and implement using Java Write Frontend BDD tests and implement using Selenium and Java Integrate BDD testing into Azure CI Pipeline Fix Frontend and Backend Bugs found using BDD Testing Manual Testing with JIRA Frontend Developer Internship - Digital Twin Link to heading Create interactive dashboard using react Display collected room info using backend data Lab Technician - Cal Poly Link to heading Implement software to control and analyze data for atomic clock Design GUI for Serial Communications in python Refactor LabView code into python scripts California Polytechnic University Link to heading Bachelor’s of Science in Physics Programming Languages Link to heading C# / Java C / C++ Typescript / Javascript HTML and CSS C# GDScript References Link to heading Zackary NJ peterson
